alert.note: Alert for Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 11:18AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany, southeastern Tangipahoa, eastern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and Pearl River Counties through NOON CST... At 1118 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Baxterville to 6 miles west of Madisonville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Picayune, Covington, Poplarville, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Varnado, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Lacombe, Enon, Crossroads, Robert, Bush, Mcneil and Angie. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 43 and 78. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 21 and 26. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 11 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
